title: Bug 6410: File marked as unchanged but is dirtied by code assist
description: When using code assist in a Java file, the file is marked as unchanged even though it is actually dirtied
OB: When using code assist in a Java file, the file is marked as unchanged in the editor
EB: When using code assist in a Java file, the file should be marked as dirtied in the editor
SR:
1. Open a Java file. 
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call. 
3. For example, consider "I" to be the cursor below:
   Object o = anotherObject.method(I);
4. Press Ctrl + Space to invoke code assist.
